result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory L Martin

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:00 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Cory L Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Barnes provides an update; she has discovery but has received some additional documents from her client that she needs to share with the ADA assigned.  Atty. Barnes is requesting another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:38 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cory L Martin appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Priya Barnes appeared by Zoom video for Cory L Martin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Barnes provides an update; she was just appointed is waiting on discovery as well as an offer.  Atty. Barnes requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Barnes.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Barnes requesting her client be allowed to appear by Zoom for the 9/19/22 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/14/22 - Zoom appearance approved.**
appointing Attorney Priya Barnes
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:06 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Cory L Martin in court.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant has been to the Public Defender office to see if he qualifies.  Defendant advises that he did call the PD's office but they advised him he needed to obtain a document from his old employer but he cannot get that information.  Atty. Nimmer appears as a friend of the Court.  Atty. Nimmer confirms that documentation is needed as proof the defendant lost their job, but sometimes that can be waived.  Atty. Nimmer will get the defendant's information to assist in getting a PD appointed.  Court advises the defendant to report to the Public defender's office after court today.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:10 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Cory L Martin in court.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes before the matter was called on the record the defendant had stepped out to call the Public Defender's office to see if he would qualify for representation.  Court inquires if the defendant qualified for representation.  Defendant advises that he needs to gather some additional information to provide to the Public Defender's office before they can determine if he is eligible.  Court will adjourn to allow time for the defendant to gather the information needed for the Public Defender's office.  Court adjourns for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant changed phone from (971)224-9724 to (317)723-2421 on 06-10-2022
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:10 PM Defendant Cory L Martin in court, in custody with State Public Defender Law Intern Cuca Longoria.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Longoria appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
